         More!!

         The energy exploded, and she nearly drowned in a tsunami of power and euphoria beyond words. Each throb now brought a surge in size. An aura of power radiated from every last inch of her, seeping out her pores. She urged it to grow, and grow her in return. More and more, bigger and bigger, stronger and stronger. No trace of May's old, scrawny body could be left behind. And the aura gave her exactly what she wanted.

         But after a moment, the feeling started to fade. The size-surges weakened in potency. Her new aura...didn't exactly disappear, it just seemed to retreat inside of her. Her brain tingled and an odd feeling between it and the power, which was once again nestled inside her core, appeared between them. A link between them? Could she control this power now? And if so, what could she do with it?

         A cool sensation nipped all over her skin, drawing her attention. It felt soothing. She came down from her high a bit at a time, awareness returning to her in equal measures. Even with her eyes still closed, May could tell her silence-stricken audience was still there. Some of them might have run off, but most were undoubtedly too paralyzed with shock to move or speak.

         Even so, the silence seemed a bit strange. But why- Oh, right. The department store entrance. She destroyed it and set off the alarms. Someone must have been able to take their eyes off her long enough to turn them off. She'd have to make up for the damage somehow.

         May decided it best to set those thoughts aside for the time. She opened her eyes looked out upon the crowd. None of them came close to matching her height. The fact brought a smile to her face. She was taller, buffer, stronger, and better endowed than any human in existence now. A true monolith of a woman. If only there were a mirror her size; she absolutely had to see the effects of her latest Rare Candy!

         But all things considered, May had to admit she currently felt...
11332111121.title: Go Bigger or Go Home

choices: The pair starts to look for Felix
May notices someone she knows in the center
113322.content:
The tingling in May's stomach grew stronger and stronger. May smiled, knowing that something incredible was about to happen. She waited. And waited.........and waited. Nothing happened. Absolutely nothing. May sighed and searched the unassuming bag again for some clue on who owned it.

After several minutes of rummaging through the bag May found something buried under all the rare candy. She pulled out a rather battered looking pokedex. The pokedex had the name Felix written in white chalk.

"Felix...." said May. The name was unfamiliar to her.

She looked around again and saw nothing. No footprints. No signs of anybody being there besides her. Shrugging, May decided to take the bag to the pokemon center to see if she could find this Felix.

Walking the way towards the center, May noticed the tingling in her stomach was getting slightly different. It didn't feel any stronger but it did felt different that May couldn't explain how even to herself

The center was in sight when May noticed a pokemon that she never saw before. The pokemon looked like a fox in robes. The fox pokemon was standing in front of the center with an anxious look on its face. As May came up to the center, the fox turned to May.

"[Excuse me]" said a feminine voice in May's head. "[Have you seen a twenty-year old trainer with short black hair. He answers to the name of Felix]"

"Whoa" said May, startled to hear a voice in her head. "You must be a psychic pokemon, I'm guessing"

"[I'm a delphox, a pokemon from the Kalos region]"

"Kalos?" Asked May. "That's awfully far off... wait.....did you say Felix?" May pulled the battered pokedex from the bag slung over her shoulder.

"[That's Felix's dex alright]" said delphox. "[Where did you find this? Where is he?!]

"I don't know" said May and proceeded to tell the fox how she came to find the bag and pokedex.


(A/N: The muscle gaining is taking it's time isn't it? ^^)
113322.title: Missing Trainer

choices: Just ask for muscles.
Way less tiredness, way more working out.
Match the strength of her Pokemon.
Get to know the old culture more. A lot more...
Ooh! Ooh! I've got some better ideas!
12.content:
"It's gotta be at the center of the island," May muttered to herself as she pushed her way through some plant life. "Stuff like this always is."

         It was an island located many miles east of Hoenn. After an expedition a few years back, it steadily grew into a successful tourist attraction both as a vacation hotspot and a place for adventure. Those on vacation could go on tours of all the remnants of a lost civilization--one that still had far more questions than answers--while the more adventurous types could explore the yet untouched landmarks and see many varieties of Pokemon. They were mostly Hoenn-native species, but there were also many from Kanto, Johto, and even some Sinnoh and Unova Pokemon. Indeed, Lostworld Island had plenty to offer for everyone.

         There was only one thing May wanted to see, though, and she had just found it. The trainer let out a content sigh as she stepped onto the site of an abandoned temple, located at the base of a tall mountain in the center of the island. There was no solid information on it yet, but archeologists guessed from the scriptures found within that the island had come to worship a Jirachi that made its home on the island. There was no knowing for sure if it even existed in the first place. All the same, May thought it was worth checking out. It wasn't different from any other abandoned temple, with grey pillars in various states of disrepair and the structure itself somehow staying in decent enough condition to not collapse into itself. The oddest part, in May's opinion, was the lack of vegetation covering everything, as if nature made it a point to avoid growing in the area.

         The inside of the temple was no different, as the only defining feature was a small series of steps leading up to a small stage and a chest large enough to fit a grown man. As May made a note in the back of her head of the minimalistic architecture, she turned her full attention to the chest, which seemed to be the only part of the temple that had any sort of unique design on it. There still wasn't much to speak of, just a charmingly archaic caricature of Jirachi made to give the impression that it was glowing.

         Weird, May thought, Why is that the only thing with any markings? She tapped a finger to her cheek. They couldn't have put Jirachi in there, could they? With hesitation that lasted all of half a second, she placed her hands on the side of the lid covering the chest and pushed hard. About a minute of exertion rewarded her when the lid moved just enough to allow May a peek inside...

         Light poured out of the chest and forced the trainer to cover her eyes. When it finally dimmed enough for May to open her eyes, she gasped at the Pokemon floating before her. It was definitely a Jirachi, star-shaped head and all, but it wasn't quite as May recognized. Its eye markings, wish tags, and torso all had a red coloration instead of the usual green. It yawned for a good few seconds and rubbed its eyes. Jirachi stared at May with the look of a teenager woken up far too early.

         "Hey, how long have I been gone?" Its voice suited its demeanor far too well, as it sounded like a teenaged boy still half-asleep. "I guess I slept through a few generations by accident. Whoops. That's, uh, that's my bad." May tried to answer the Pokemon, but all that came out of her mouth was an "uh".

         The two stared at each other for the better part of a minute. Finally, May shook her head and forced a chuckle. "Sorry, I wasn't expecting something to actually be in there." She pointed to the chest below the floating creature.

         "Someone," Jirachi replied. "And yeah, I was in there and stuff." He gave the trainer a once-over. "So, uh, how long have I been gone?"

         "I... don't really know. But it couldn't have been too long. You talk like any teen would."

         The Pokemon tilted its head to one side. "Dude, I've always talked like this. Did you humans take a few centuries to catch up with my lingo, or something?" It shrugged and continued speaking before May could get a word in. "Ah, whatevs. If you found me, then you've got a wish to make. Sooooo... what's up? Whaddaya want?"

         "Uh..." May scratched the back of her head. She definitely wanted to check out the island when she heard about the Jirachi, but she didn't come looking with any particular wish in mind. "I didn't actually expect to find you when I came here, so..."

         "Yeah? Well..." Jirachi gestured at its body. "Here I am. In the flesh. Floating before you. Giving you one free wish. And only one. So make it count." It glanced away for a moment. "Oh, and be specific so I don't screw it up for you or whatever. That'd probably kinda suck."

         "Good call. Now let's see..." May crossed her arms and closed her eyes in thought. What did she want?

------


So what's May going to wish for? It's obviously going to end in her growing some serious muscles (not to mention extra boobage and a bit of height), but how's that gonna happen?

-She simply asks for muscles. It would certainly help with giving the impression of a strong trainer.
-She wishes to never get tired and to always be full of energy. She'd still need to eat and drink, but she'd otherwise be free to train her Pokemon--and more importantly, her body--24/7.
-She wants to be as strong as her Pokemon, at least physically speaking. Then she could grow stronger with them.
-She suddenly finds herself curious about the island's old culture, and wishes to know it inside and out. This comes with the side-effect of her body gradually altering itself to match the culture's women. Turns out they were full-blown Amazon ladies, with the muscles and the breasts and the tallness and everything.
12.title: She makes a wish on Jirachi.

choices: ... still lean body. Still, something seems different about it.
... lightly toned body.
... clearly defined muscles.
122.content:
It'll have to be something simple, May thought, something I can use whenever and not have it blow up in my face. And then I'll need to make sure I have the time to use it.

         Then it hit her. The trainer's face visibly lit up as she turned back to Jirachi.

         "I've made my decision," May said. "I wish that to always be full of energy, to never need any rest ever again!"

         Jirachi tilted its head to one side. "Huh. Sounds kinda cool. Mind if I ask where you're going with this?"

         "Well..." May absentmindedly scratched the back of her head. "See, my mom used to always talk about how much more time we'd all have if we didn't have to sleep or take breaks, and I kinda started agreeing with her after a while. Plus, I could always use more training."

         "Wouldn't your Pokemon get tired?"

         "No, I mean training myself, like exercise and stuff. I think my Pokemon are strong enough as is."

         The shiny Pokemon nodded. "Alright, cool. Lemme just whip that up, then."

         Its wish tags began to glow a bright white, followed by the rest of its body. May shielded her eyes as the light engulfed the entire temple. A tingling sensation swept over the trainer's skin, faint at first, but it grew stronger with each passing second. Her mind began urging her to run, to jump, to do something. She might have, too, if she weren't blinded by the shiny Jirachi's obnoxious light.

         "'Kay, have fun with that. Oh, and I threw in a little something extra."

         The light finally dimmed down, and May opened her eyes. The temple was once again empty, not counting herself and the chest Jirachi was in. The tingling feeling was still with her, and had her whole body nearly thrumming with nervous energy. May's fingers twitched. She had to do something, anything physically demanding.

         "I think I'll take a nice little jog around the island."

         At that, she was off like a rocket. The wind whipped past her as she darted into the forest, drawing curious glances from the wild Pokemon. May payed them no mind. As the trainer weaved her way through the many trees and bushes, she reveled in how her body showed no signs of fatigue. No panting, no burning sensation in her chest, not even a single drop of sweat down her brow.

         "That Jirachi's a real miracle worker!" May exclaimed.

         It would take her some time before she finally reached the edge of the forest, and even longer before making it to the coast, but she didn't care. She had all the time in the world, and all the energy to take advantage of that.

------

         The sun had set hours ago. Only the (very) occasional tourist or trainer would pop up. Even the nocturnal Pokemon species were rather few and far between, though May assumed most of them just stuck to the forest. Though her run had slowed to a jog, she felt no less tired than when she started. If anything, she was feeling even better.

         I wonder if I should take a second lap. That wish has worked wonders so far, but it might... Wait, didn't I already pass the port?

         Sure enough, May found herself jogging past the Lostworld Island port for the second time that night. Two laps around the island without her realizing it, and she wasn't even remotely tired. A giggle escaped the trainer's lips.

         "Works like a charm," she whispered to herself. "At least for now. Maybe one more lap. Or two. Or maybe until morning. Yeah, morning sounds good."

------

         Light peaked over the horizon as May approached the port for the fourth time in a row. Her jog lasted all night, and she was only just now slowing down to a walk. Curiously, the trainer's clothes were feeling a bit more snug than she remembered. Humming in thought, and with a slight bounce in her step, May headed over to the port's hotel. Said hotel's glass double door presented a perfect reflection of the trainer, showing off her...
122.title: May the Untiring

choices: May re-examines herself in her bathroom mirror.
May, as a force of habit, goes right to bed.
CAN'T...SLEEP...MUST...JOG...MORE.
1221.content:
May experienced a little discomfort as she sauntered to the hotel's glass doors. Perhaps her shorts rode up her hips, or perhaps her sleeves stuck a bit too tight to her arms. Either way, she felt a bit more tight in her clothing than she had remembered.

         Upon glancing at her reflection in the glass, May cocked her head. "Something's... different," she observed. Her eyes darted up and down her lean figure, sizing it up. She wore a slight scowl, as if she couldn't place something about her reflection. Somehow, the figure in the glass looked more present. Maybe it was her posture; May seemed to stand a little more erect than she was used to. "I can't quite place it," she continued, leaning over and appraising her reflection once more. She strained to scratch her neck, failing to notice that it seemed to require a bit more effort to bend her arm back that far.

         "Huh, nothing seems out-of place," May said to herself, "yet something's definitely off about my reflection." May stepped away from her reflection and noted her somewhat constrained stride, as if she had a tight rubber band around her thighs. "I might've perspired a bit more than I thought on that jog," May mused, "which I didn't feel was very much, if at all."

May's confusion only heightened as the elevator to her floor rose. She had wiped her brow as a force of habit; upon inspection of her glove, no sweat had wiped off her face. May only found the slightest traces of natural skin oil. She began to tap her foot as the elevator climbed, but stopped when she realized that it was causing her shorts to ride up her rear end. May shifted about in both physical and mental discomfort. Something in her reflection certainly struck her as different, but she couldn't quite put her finger on it.

Maybe I'll think about it more in the morning, May thought, as the elevator's bell chimed and the metal doors slid open.

Though May knew that it was going to be a long night as she perkily strode to her room and shut and locked the door.
1221.title: ...Still-lean body.

choices: Excercises Normally (Slow Growth)
Lifts Absurd Weights to Push Herself (Fast Growth)
12211.content:
After staying up all night, and jogging around the entire island at that, May found that she had to relieve herself. "I may as well go ahead and take a shower before I go to bed," she thought, despite the fact that she barely, if at all, had sweat during her short marathon. So she grabbed a change of clothes and entered the bathroom.

After preparing the shower and taking of her clothes, May caught a peek of herself in the bathroom mirror. "Holy crap," she said aloud, "That's what it was," as the pieces fit together in her mind finally. Her legs and rear had plumped and perked up slightly with muscle. Not enough to be obvious, but now her legs looked strong. Her core, as well, had the beginnings of definition of a meek four-pack. "Wow, I look good," May said, checking out her newish assets.

Realizing the shower had been running for some time now, she made her way into the stall, and resumed her thoughts.

"Hmm, if a light jog could tone up my legs and tummy a bit, what would happen if I really started...what's it called? Oh, working out!" May's mind slowly drifted to ideas of lifting weights, increasing her strength and size more and more. "I wonder how fast it works?" May asked her shower head, "Cause I did get a lot of exercise compared to normal, running for a few hours straight. That might be what caused this change."

Either way, May became more and more excited about the idea of achieving her fitness goals, possibly even surpassing them. Isn't that why she made the wish in the first place? But, she had decided that she would act more on this after a good nights rest, well, early morning nap.

But as she donned her pajamas and laid into the hotel's surprisingly comfy bed, she found that she kept tossing and turning. This went on for a few hours before she realized, "Oh yeah, endless energy, no need to sleep. Right. Thanks, Jirachi."

May sat up and after a short time, decided on her course of action.
12211.title: Mirrored Muscles

choices: May notices a difference right away.
May fails to notice, but that doesn't mean that she's necessarily stopped.
12213.content:
"I can't sleep. I just can't! I can't just stand up here and do nothing all night!"

         May's wish on Jirachi had worked alright. May had absolutely zero need to sleep and constantly brimmed with vim to the boiling point. She found out the hard way that night when she simply tossed and turned in her bed, constantly stimulated, her eyes darting around the room, her fingers twitching.

         With her wish came literally all the time in the world. She had her goal of training her own body in conjunction with her PokÃ©mon's, and she certainly could achieve that now that she had nigh-unlimited energy.

         For about an hour, May lay in bed in discomfort. She rolled out of bed and did push-ups, sit-ups, anything that would normally burn her out very quickly. She found that she could do these things with ease, without so much as an ache in the stomach or a drop of sweat on the brow.

         May looked out the window. With all this extra time from the now un-necessity of sleep, she could run jogs like the first over-night jog she did. She could sprint without a qualm, without an ache. "Maybe I'll go for another run," May resolved, removing her nightgown and tugging on (with noticeably more effort) her clothing and tying her bandana around her head. Just to warm up she took the stairs instead of the elevator.

         By the time May hit the ground floor, she felt that her clothing squeezed her even more tightly than they had earlier that day. She screwed up her face as she stiffly walked out the glass doors, the moon shining down upon the port. May decided not to think too much of the tightness in her clothing as she ran to the beach.

         It wasn't difficult to forget the tightness as May once more felt the exhilaration of being able to run miles and miles on end without tiring. As her shoes dug into the sand, May picked up the pace, her stride lengthening more and more until she realized she had broken into a sprint. Like a distance runner, she pumped her arms and breathed in and out rhythmically, a controlled yet frenetic breathing that upped her hype as if she was a Kingdra using Dragon Dance.

         May hollered in excitement as she hurtled faster, faster, untiring, unwavering. The cool wind blasted her face before stopping abruptly as May dashed up a hill, across an empty street, and into the forest. Perhaps by then she had hit the absolute velocity of a human being. She had no need to stop, since she certainly wasn't tired at all. She had as much time as she wanted, and she could run and run and run for as long as she wanted to.

         The thought seemed to do well for May's confidence and posture, as she found her vantage rising as she stood up straighter, basking in the glorious feeling of unabated exertion. And she actually was rising. The bottom of her shirt began to untuck from her pants and creep slowly up her torso as a result of May continuously pumping her arms. Her clothing, becoming pasted more and more tightly to her skin by the minute, creaked with each movement of May's joints. May's chest pushed outward from her shirt as her sleeves seemed to tighten a bit more on her shoulders. May noticed none of this as she passed into the forest. Her yelling cleared the path of any wandering Stantlers or Murkrows in her way.

         The night went on like this, with May circling the island once more, twice, three times, following her earlier path. Finally, she stopped in the middle of a clearing in the forest, not even panting.

         Quiet. Nothing but the chirps of Kricketots and Kricketunes and the dancing lights of Volbeat and Illumise accompanied May in the forest. May laughed, her arms akimbo, tilting her head to the sky. "You know what?" she announced to no one in particular. "I really like this!"

         Yet still, something felt different. Not necessarily bad, but different.
12213.title: A Hard Day's Night, A Hard Night in General

choices: May returns to her room to take a closer look at her new body.
May goes to the hotel gym to experiment with more exercise.
Your choice?
1222.content:
...lightly toned body. Wait, lightly toned? May found herself coming down from the high of her endless exercise and took a good, long look at her reflection in the hotel door. To her surprise, she found that the previous night of nonstop exertion had seemingly paid off quite well for her body. Granted, May wasn't exactly out of shape before, as one would expect of a girl who made her living on a Pokemon journey, but she was always a bit...soft, seeing as her preference for Contests left little room for more martial training. Now, though, her body had taken on a decidedly more athletic look; her tight shorts seemed even tighter over her thick, firm thighs, with visible muscle definition along them and her exposed calves. Further up, her red top had begun to ride up slightly over her now rather chiseled stomach, showing the beginnings of abs, and she displayed slightly defined biceps through her short sleeves.

"Whoa..." she muttered to herself, curiously flexing and inspecting her new muscles. "Man, I knew I was working out pretty hard, but I didn't think it would show this quickly!" She was already starting to draw a few curious eyes from other trainers, who wondered why the girl had stopped to apparently check herself out in public, but she paid them no mind, too caught up in what was going on. "Hmm...I guess it makes sense that having unlimited energy would mean I can work out a lot harder than a normal person, but even this seems like a little much...plus that wouldn't explain why I seem taller...maybe this is the 'extra' Jirachi was talking about?" Before May could spend any longer ruminating on her situation, she was snapped out of it by the hotel manager tapping on the other side of the glass, motioning for her to stop holding up the other customers. "Oops...sorry about that, ehehe..." she said nervously, opening the door and hurrying back inside.
1222.title: A more fit May

choices: May decides to stick around the island a bit before heading back to Hoenn.
May heads back to Petalburg and pays her family a visit.
12221.content:
Walking felt different all of a sudden. The bad kind of different. May could deal with the tighter clothes, but discovering why they were tight also made her realize that her normal posture didn't suit her at all. Her legs rubbed together, as did her arms against her sides, and she found it rather uncomfortable.

         May stepped into an elevator and wedged herself into a corner, away from everyone else. She felt awkward enough without having to endure a bunch of strangers staring at her changed body. Granted, they didn't know her body had even changed in the first place, but...

         The elevator finally opened up on the fourth floor, and May shuffled out behind everyone else.

         407... 408... There we go, 409.

         Swiping her card key through the lock, May quickly slipped into her room and shut the door behind her. Since she was in a hurry to find Jirachi the day before, absolutely nothing had been touched since her arrival. It seemed like a waste of money, in retrospect, but then again she wasn't expecting to never need sleep again. She only planned on staying for one night anyway.

         With a sigh, May walked over to the bathroom and stood in front of the mirror. Her reflection stared back, toned muscles and all. She sighed again. While not skin tight, her clothes still served to emphasize her larger frame. It made her feel bulky, like she was turning into an over-pumped bodybuilder.

         May frowned. "Should a Pokemon Coordinator really have this kind of body?"

         To May, winning a contest was all about grace, something she never associated with muscles. Those were about nothing more than raw power, not to mention a broader frame that would doubtlessly impede any sort of grace in her routine. Being a giant, lumbering mass of muscle probably wouldn't win her many fans either.

         On the other hand, it certainly beat looking like a stick figure with skin and bones. Turning a bit to the side, May slowly flexed her right arm, watching the muscles tense. She did this a few times before letting her mind wonder. How big could she get, anyway...?

         The Verdanturf Town Contest Hall was fit to burst. With row after row of seats packed with people, one would expect the audience to be cheering their congratulations to the winner of the most recent contest. They certainly would have, too, if it weren't for one little problem...

         "S-s-so," stammered MC Vivian Meridian, "er, May, was it? C-congratulations on your s-splendid victory! If-if I may ask, w-w-what's your secret?"

         "May smash competition! Smash it good!"

         To say that May was utterly gigantic would be the understatement of the millennium. Standing at an absurd 35 feet tall (requiring Vivian to use a ladder to be at eye level), her body could hardly be considered human. Biceps like boulders, legs larger than stone pillars, breasts the size of wrecking balls... The only part of the coordinator's body that wasn't obscenely huge was her head, and that only served as a stark contrast to the rest of her. How could a hulking monstrosity of a person ever fit inside the Contest Hall?

         One only needed to glance at the hulking monstrosity-sized holes leading up to the stage to answer that question.

         May jolted out of her daydream with a gasp, stopping mid-flex. She didn't realize she was still flexing.

         "Okay, none of that! Definitely none of that!" The trainer hugged herself tightly. "I don't wanna turn into a muscle monster!"

         Taking a few deep breaths, May braced herself against the sink. She stepped back when her breathing became even again.

         "Actually... how big can I get?"

         She flexed her arm again. The way her muscles tensed felt... interesting. A good kind of interesting, even.

         "This might not be too bad after all. It's a pretty healthy look, if I do say so myself. Not sure if I'd like it any bigger than this, but--"

         A loud growl came from her stomach. May blushed. It occurred to her that needing rest and needing food were too totally different things. Her stomach growled again.

         "I know, I know! Shut up! I'll get some breakfast, geez!"

         With one last sigh, May headed on out of her room.

-----

         One sizable meal later...
12221.title: Upon closer inspection...

choices: May brings out all of her Pokemon with her to see if it worked.
She finds that she really can lift a small boulder.
Oh no! May locks eyes with a random trainer and is forced to do battle.
123.content:
I could wish for to best trainer in the land, with strongest and prettiest Pokemon in the region, she thought to herself.
But that would take away a lot of the reward. If I don't get there by my own power it won't feel like I've earned it.
That doesn't mean to say I can't use a little help.

May then thought about all the problems her Pokemon caused her. If only she could understand them better. She could get stop Munchlax from eating her food or understand why Skitty was so moody at times. If only all of them could have as strong a bond as I do with Blaziken.

"Okay Jirachi," she said after a few more moments of thought. "I wish I was better connected with my Pokemon." Jirachi looked at her confused and May realized she wasn't specific enough. Suddenly getting a thought about him interpreting her wish as being physically stuck to her Pokemon she hastily continued "You know, better connected like able to understand them better, being able to know how they feel and share in their happiness and experiences".

Jirachi looked at her a few moments then said "Oh, I getcha. You want to be closer and share their experiences eh?" May didn't know if he properly understood what she wanted but felt it would be rude to correct him. It was a free wish after all. Anything should be better than nothing and it sounded like he had the gist of the wish.

"Yeah that's about it."

"Okay, then stand back," the small Pokemon replied. Its tags then began to glow white. White streams of light poured out from them and hit May in the chest, while another hit her Poke-balls. The light covered more of her with each passing second. May could feel her consciousness expanding and suddenly felt massive amounts of strength pouring into her. The light started to feel warmer as she felt it filling her. She started feeling various emotions; happiness, sadness, a desire to fight, and hunger.

And then the light stopped and May was once again alone in the temple. Her body felt more alive than it had ever been before and she felt like she could lift a small boulder.

What happens next?
123.title: Match the strength of her Pokemon.

choices: May decides to feed her Pokemon and remembers she has a rare candy.
May also feels Blaziken's desire to fight and so fights Blaziken.
A group of wild Pokemon attack and May retaliates.
1231.content: She released all of her Pokemon that she had with her; Blaziken, Munchlax, Skitty, Beautifly, Venusaur, and Glaceon. "Ah, Floaroma Town...pretty as always."

May smiled as she inhaled the flowery aroma of the colorful town. It was quite a sight to behold, and she was happy to visit, even if she wouldn't stay for long. She had already been to Sinnoh once, mainly for a contest held some time ago, but now? She was here to take in the sights, and maybe see if any of her friends were there, whether it be Dawn, or maybe even Ash. Regardless, she decided to take a stop in Floaroma Town, partial because of its beauty, and partially because of the honey sold in Floaroma Meadow. The honey sold there, while meant to attract wild Pokémon of the rare variety, was also a very nice treat to enjoy every now and then, usually with other foods. And today, May wanted to buy a few jars, so she made the short walk to Floaroma Meadow.
Upon arriving, she was welcomed by the warm smile of an old man, the same old honey seller that everyone knows. May smiled back, and she came up to his usual selling stand, which as always was small and well organized.

"Looking to buy some honey, young miss?"

May couldn't help but grin when he said that. She nodded as his question, and began to make her order.
"Yup! I just wanted to get some honey for the road, less for a Pokémon hunt, more for the flavor. It is pretty sweet, after all."

The old man nodded, and begins to collect a few jars of yellow Combee honey. As he did so, May looked around the stand a bit more, and noticed a rather small section with some strange, pink liquid, jarred up just like the usual Combee honey.

"Excuse me, but what's that pink stuff over there?"

"Oh, that? Well...when I was harvesting the honey, as usual, a few of the Combee were oddly colored. They were quite hyper too, almost moving too fast. If it weren't for my Pokémon, they would have overpowered me rather quickly!" He sighs. "Apart from that, I don't think there's much of a difference...it might be a bit sweeter, or maybe more rich in flavor.
